newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: TENNIS-AUSTRALIA TAKE TSAKE FED CUP STRANGLEHOLD.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-AUSTRALIA TAKE TSAKE FED CUP STRANGLEHOLD.

text.p: Australia took a 2-0 stranglehold on their Fed Cup world group two tennis match against South Africa at Westridge Park on Saturday by winning both the opening singles.
Australian number one Annabel Ellwood punished some underpowered serving to beat Joannette Kruger in the opening rubber.
And Rachel McQuillan, world-ranked 119, overcame 13th ranked Amanda Coetzer in a second set tie break to put Australia in control of the tie.
McQuillan took the first set 6-3 but trailed 5-3 in an error-strewn second before having the first of three match points at 6-5.
An off-key Coetzer saved that to force the rubber into a tie break and held five match points herself before going down 12-10.
